original: @183a # // rgya gar skad du /🔽ma h'a y'a na pa tha kra ma /🔽bod skad du /
analyzed: @183a # // rgya gar skad du / ma h'a y'a na pa tha kra ma / bod skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Mahayana Pathakrama🔽In Tibetan:🔽🔽

original: theg pa chen po'i lam gyi rim pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam gyi rim pa /
translated: The Great Way: Stages of the Path

original: dpal 'jam pa'i mgon la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal 'jam pa'i mgon la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Manjushri.

original: dpal ldan mgon po kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: dpal ldan mgon po kun rang bzhin //
translated: The glorious protector is the nature of all,🔽and the protector of the world is the nature of all.

original: rnam snang mjad la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rnam snang mjad la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to Vairochana,

original: skal chen dang ldan dga' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skal chen dang ldan dga' ba'i phyir //
translated: and for the sake of delighting those with great fortune,

original: thag chen lam rim bshad par bya //
analyzed: thag chen lam rim bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the stages of the path of the Great Way.

original: gang zhig mi khom gnas spangs te //
analyzed: gang zhig mi khom gnas spangs te //
translated: Those who have abandoned the states without opportunity

original: chos spyod skal ba ldan pa'i tshe //
analyzed: chos spyod skal ba ldan pa'i tshe //
translated: and have the fortune to practice the Dharma,

original: bdag nyid brtson par mi byed pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid brtson par mi byed pa //
translated: if they do not strive

original: 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen cing //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen cing //
translated: when they are afflicted by the suffering of death,

original: bzhin gyur mdangs yal bkrag bor tshe //
analyzed: bzhin gyur mdangs yal bkrag bor tshe //
translated: when their faces change, their complexions fade, and their voices are hoarse,

original: bdag la 'gyod par cis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag la 'gyod par cis mi 'gyur //
translated: why would they not have regret?

original: 'tsho ba phra mo'i @183b ched dag tu //
analyzed: 'tsho ba phra mo'i @183b ched dag tu //
translated: If for the sake of the most trivial of needs

original: sdug bsngal chen po bzod gyur na //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po bzod gyur na //
translated: one endures great suffering,

original: sdug bsngal kun dang bral 'dod pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun dang bral 'dod pas //
translated: why would one who wishes to be free from all suffering

original: bzong pa chen po cis mi bsten //
analyzed: bzong pa chen po cis mi bsten //
translated: not rely on great endurance?

original: de bas sdug bsngal 'dor 'dod rnams //
analyzed: de bas sdug bsngal 'dor 'dod rnams //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to abandon suffering

original: theg chen lam la brtson pa dang // dge pa'i bshegs la bsnyen bkur zhes //
analyzed: theg chen lam la brtson pa dang // dge pa'i bshegs la bsnyen bkur zhes //
translated: And serve the spiritual friend.

original: bdag ni khyed la de skad gdams //
analyzed: bdag ni khyed la de skad gdams //
translated: I advise you thus.

original: lnga brgya tha ma'i dus kyi tshe //
analyzed: lnga brgya tha ma'i dus kyi tshe //
translated: In the time of the last five hundred years,

original: snyigs ma lnga yi sems can rnams //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga yi sems can rnams //
translated: Sentient beings of the five degenerations,

original: theg chen skal ldan ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: theg chen skal ldan ngo mtshar che //
translated: Are wondrously endowed with the Great Vehicle.

original: de bas spro ba chen po bskyed //
analyzed: de bas spro ba chen po bskyed //
translated: Therefore, generate great enthusiasm.

original: de la theg chen rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: de la theg chen rnam gnyis te //
translated: There are two kinds of the Great Vehicle:🔽The Great Vehicle of the perfections and so forth,

original: pha rol phyin sogs theg chen dang // theg pa chen po gsang sngags te //
analyzed: pha rol phyin sogs theg chen dang // theg pa chen po gsang sngags te //
translated: And the Secret Mantra Great Vehicle.

original: de don bsdus rgyas shin tu rgyas //
analyzed: de don bsdus rgyas shin tu rgyas //
translated: Its meaning is summarized, extensive, and very extensive.

original: ngo bo la sogs brjod par bya //
analyzed: ngo bo la sogs brjod par bya //
translated: I will explain its essence and so forth.

original: dad sogs bcas rnams mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: dad sogs bcas rnams mnyan par gyis //
translated: Listen with faith and so on.

original: gang zhig pha rol phyin 'dod pa //🔽cho ga lnga yi rim pa yis //
analyzed: gang zhig pha rol phyin 'dod pa // cho ga lnga yi rim pa yis //
translated: Those who desire the perfections

original: lam rnams la ni bgrod bya ste //
analyzed: lam rnams la ni bgrod bya ste //
translated: Should travel the paths by the stages of the five rites,

original: pha rol phyin sogs ldan par ro //
analyzed: pha rol phyin sogs ldan par ro //
translated: Endowed with the perfections and so forth.🔽The generation of bodhicitta, taking the vow,🔽Knowing the characteristics of guarding it,

original: sems bskyed sdom pa nod pa dang // de bsrung mtshan nyid shes bya dang // sems bskyed spyod pa dag pa ste //
analyzed: sems bskyed sdom pa nod pa dang // de bsrung mtshan nyid shes bya dang // sems bskyed spyod pa dag pa ste //
translated: The purity of the conduct of generating bodhicitta,

original: 'di ni cho ga lngar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni cho ga lngar 'dod do //
translated: This is held to be the five rites.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the summary verse.

original: da ni de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, that should be taught in detail.

original: de yang dang po rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis /🔽yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la /
analyzed: de yang dang po rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis / yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la /
translated: Moreover, a person who belongs to the spiritual lineage🔽should generate the thought of supreme enlightenment

original: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed par bya zhing sngom pa nod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed par bya zhing sngom pa nod par bya'o //
translated: in the presence of a true spiritual friend and should take the vow.

original: de nas de mi nyams par bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de mi nyams par bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Then, he should strive to protect it from degeneration.

original: de ltar snod du rung ba dang thos pa'i shes rab kyis theg pa chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mnyan nas /
analyzed: de ltar snod du rung ba dang thos pa'i shes rab kyis theg pa chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mnyan nas /
translated: Thus, having become a suitable vessel and having listened to the perfection of wisdom of the Great Vehicle and so forth with the wisdom of hearing,

original: spang par bya ba dang / spong byed dang / spang ba'i thabs dang / spangs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spang par bya ba dang / spong byed dang / spang ba'i thabs dang / spangs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: he should understand the characteristics of what is to be abandoned, the abandonment, the means of abandoning, the result of abandoning, and so forth.

original: de nas sems bskyed par bya ste /🔽de yang yan lag rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas sems bskyed par bya ste / de yang yan lag rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Then, he should generate the thought.🔽Moreover, it has five branches.

original: de la yan lag lnga ni /
analyzed: de la yan lag lnga ni /
translated: The five branches are:

original: lam dang lam gyi grogs rgyud la bskyed pa dang / de'i yul dang / spang bar bya ba dang / spong pa'i thabs dang / lam des spangs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lam dang lam gyi grogs rgyud la bskyed pa dang / de'i yul dang / spang bar bya ba dang / spong pa'i thabs dang / lam des spangs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: and the result of abandoning by means of the path.🔽The path is the path of accumulation,🔽the path of preparation,🔽the path of seeing,

original: de la lam ni tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la lam ni tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: and the path of cultivation.

original: lam gyi yan lag ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The factors of the path are the two aspects of tranquility and insight.🔽The objects are the two types of objects:

original: yul ni 'jug pa'i yul dang / dmigs pa'i yul rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yul ni 'jug pa'i yul dang / dmigs pa'i yul rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: the object of engagement and the object of observation.

original: spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //🔽spang @184a * //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o // spang @184a * //
translated: What is to be abandoned is the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: ba'i thabs ni lam gyi rim pa bzhin du bya ste /🔽spyang bya chen po gnyen po chung dus spang la /
analyzed: ba'i thabs ni lam gyi rim pa bzhin du bya ste / spyang bya chen po gnyen po chung dus spang la /
translated: The means of abandoning are the stages of the path.🔽The great objects of abandonment are abandoned by the small antidotes.

original: spang bya chung du gnyen pos spong ba'o //
analyzed: spang bya chung du gnyen pos spong ba'o //
translated: The small objects of abandonment are abandoned by the antidotes.

original: spangs pa las 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spangs pa las 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of abandoning is twofold.

original: spyod pa dag par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod pa dag par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The purification of conduct is twofold:

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: the state of going and so on, and the state of non-concentration.

original: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas shin tu rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas shin tu rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught in detail, in order to teach extensively,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: he should state the nature and so on of generating the Thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i yul ni gzhan gyi don no //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i yul ni gzhan gyi don no //
translated: The object of generating the Thought of enlightenment is the welfare of others.

original: ngo bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o //
translated: The nature is the desire for perfect complete enlightenment.

original: dbye ba ni rgyas par dbye na nyi shu dang gnyis so //
analyzed: dbye ba ni rgyas par dbye na nyi shu dang gnyis so //
translated: The divisions, if divided extensively, are twenty-two.

original: bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: If summarized, they are fourfold.

original: shin tu bsdu na rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: shin tu bsdu na rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: If very summarized, they are twofold.

original: de la nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni chos thams cad mngon par byang chub 'dod pas /
analyzed: de la nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni chos thams cad mngon par byang chub 'dod pas /
translated: Therein, the twenty-two are the desire for perfect enlightenment of all things.

original: 'dun pa sa lta bu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid de dus thams cad du mi 'gyur bar 'dod pas na bsam pa gser lta bu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa de dag 'phel par 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'dun pa sa lta bu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid de dus thams cad du mi 'gyur bar 'dod pas na bsam pa gser lta bu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa de dag 'phel par 'dod pas /
translated: The superior intention is like the waxing moon, since it is the cause of the increase of the factors of enlightenment.🔽The application is like fire, since it realizes nonconceptual gnosis.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi'i khyad par dang 'dra ba rtogs pas sbyor pa me lta bu dang / sems can tshad med pa'i rgyud tshim par mdzad pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gter lta bu dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi'i khyad par dang 'dra ba rtogs pas sbyor pa me lta bu dang / sems can tshad med pa'i rgyud tshim par mdzad pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gter lta bu dang /
translated: The perfection of generosity is like a treasure, since it satisfies the mind streams of limitless sentient beings.🔽The perfection of moral discipline is like a mine of jewels, since it is the source of precious qualities.

original: yon tan rin po che rnams de las 'byung pas na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu dang / mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho chen po lta bu dang /
analyzed: yon tan rin po che rnams de las 'byung pas na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu dang / mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho chen po lta bu dang /
translated: The perfection of patience is like the great ocean, since it is unshaken by any sign of the unpleasant.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa la brten pa mi phyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje lta bu dang / dmigs pa thams cad kyi rnam par g-yeng bas bsgul bar mi nus pas na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ri bo lta bu dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa la brten pa mi phyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje lta bu dang / dmigs pa thams cad kyi rnam par g-yeng bas bsgul bar mi nus pas na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ri bo lta bu dang /
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration is like a mountain, because it cannot be moved by any distraction in regard to any object.🔽The perfection of wisdom is like medicine, because it cures the disease of the two obscurations.

original: sgrib pa gnyis kyi nad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sman lta bu dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don yongs su mi spong bas thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis kyi nad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sman lta bu dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don yongs su mi spong bas thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla ma lta bu dang /
translated: The perfection of skillful means is like a guru, because it never abandons the welfare of all sentient beings in any situation.🔽The perfection of aspiration is like a wish-fulfilling gem, because it accomplishes the welfare of beings in accordance with the results of aspirations.

original: smon lam ji lta bu'i 'bras bus don mdzad pas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu @184b dang ; gdul bya'i skye bo rnams yongs su smin par byed pas na stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: smon lam ji lta bu'i 'bras bus don mdzad pas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu @184b dang ; gdul bya'i skye bo rnams yongs su smin par byed pas na stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi ma lta bu dang /
translated: The perfection of strength is like the sun, because it ripens beings to be trained.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi yid dga' bar byed pa'i chos ston pas na ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dbyangs snyan pa lta bu dang / mthu thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni //🔽gzhan gyi don lhur mdzad pas na rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi yid dga' bar byed pa'i chos ston pas na ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dbyangs snyan pa lta bu dang / mthu thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni // gzhan gyi don lhur mdzad pas na rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of intuition is like a sweet voice, because it teaches the Dharma to delight the minds of those to be trained.🔽It is like a great king, because it is dedicated to the welfare of others.

original: mdzod lta bu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: mdzod lta bu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
translated: It is like a treasury, because it is dedicated to the accumulation of merit and intuition.

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing bzhud pas lam chen po lta bu dang // zhi gnas dang lhag ma thong dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing bzhud pas lam chen po lta bu dang // zhi gnas dang lhag ma thong dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni //
translated: It is like a great road, because it is dedicated to the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par mi ltung bar bde blag tu 'gro bas bzhon pa lta bu dang // gzings dang spobs pa dang lhan cig bar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par mi ltung bar bde blag tu 'gro bas bzhon pa lta bu dang // gzings dang spobs pa dang lhan cig bar rtogs pa ni /
translated: It is like a vehicle, because it easily goes without falling into cyclic existence or the transcendence of suffering, due to the union of calm abiding and special insight.🔽It is like a bridge, because it is dedicated to the union of retention and eloquence.

original: bstan pa mtha' yas pa 'dzin cing mi zad pas bkod ma lta bu dang / chos kyi dbyings dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa mtha' yas pa 'dzin cing mi zad pas bkod ma lta bu dang / chos kyi dbyings dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni /
translated: It is like a river, because it holds and does not waste the infinite teaching.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis thos na dga' ba yin pas sgra brnyan lta bu dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig bar rtogs pa ni /🔽thams cad kyi rgyu gcig bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis thos na dga' ba yin pas sgra brnyan lta bu dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig bar rtogs pa ni / thams cad kyi rgyu gcig bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is like an echo, because it is the delight of those who desire liberation when they hear it.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir chu bo'i rgyun lta bu dang / chos kyi sku dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir chu bo'i rgyun lta bu dang / chos kyi sku dang lhan cig par rtogs pa ni //
translated: It is like a river, because it is the single cause of all and because it flows naturally.

original: don gyi bya ba thams cad de la rig las pas sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba thams cad de la rig las pas sprin lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a cloud, because all the work of the meaning is done by it.

original: de ltar nyi shu rtsa gcig po de nyid bzhir bsdu ste /🔽de yang 'dun pa la sogs pa gsum ni /
analyzed: de ltar nyi shu rtsa gcig po de nyid bzhir bsdu ste / de yang 'dun pa la sogs pa gsum ni /
translated: These twenty-one are summarized as four.

original: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The three beginning with aspiration are the stage of the beginner,

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen pa'o //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen pa'o //
translated: small, middling, and great.

original: sbyor ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Application is the stage of penetration.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The ten beginning with generosity are the causal state.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad kyis ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad kyis ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The eight beginning with the superknowledges are the resultant state.

original: de yang dang po lnga ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: de yang dang po lnga ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: Moreover, the first five are the path of distinction.

original: 'og ma gsum ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang mjug gi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'og ma gsum ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang mjug gi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The latter three are included in the stage of the Buddha, from the point of view of the preparation, the actual state, and the conclusion.

original: sems gang gis dang po'i las la mngon par sbyor ba dang / gang gi las rdzogs par byed pa dang / las rdzogs par byas pa las legs par byas pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sems gang gis dang po'i las la mngon par sbyor ba dang / gang gi las rdzogs par byed pa dang / las rdzogs par byas pa las legs par byas pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: By whatever mind one first applies oneself to action, by whatever one brings action to completion, and by whatever one brings action to completion and is well-situated, etc.

original: de dag nyid g yis su bsdus te //🔽dang @185a * //
analyzed: de dag nyid g yis su bsdus te // dang @185a * //
translated: They are included in the three realms.

original: po gsum ni sm0on pa'i sems so //
analyzed: po gsum ni sm0on pa'i sems so //
translated: The first three are of the realm of desire.

original: lhag ma bcu dgu ni 'jhig pa'i sems te //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu dgu ni 'jhig pa'i sems te //
translated: The remaining nineteen are of the realm of form.

original: de la sm0on pa ni don du gnyer pa'i rgyu ste //
analyzed: de la sm0on pa ni don du gnyer pa'i rgyu ste //
translated: Therein, the realm of desire is the cause of seeking sense-pleasures.

original: des na 'dir gzhan gyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas su 'grub par gyur cig ces gsol pa 'debs pa ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir gzhan gyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas su 'grub par gyur cig ces gsol pa 'debs pa ni smon pa'o //
translated: Here, the vow is the aspiration that one should become a Buddha for the sake of others.

original: 'jug pa'i sems ni sdom pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas spyin pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa ni 'jug pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems ni sdom pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas spyin pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa ni 'jug pa'i don yin no //

analyzed: de la sdom pa'i sems pa ste /

analyzed: lnga kun du 'gro ba'i sems pa nyid do // de'i mtshan nyid ni bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The thought of vow is the thought of taking the vow.🔽The thought of entering is the practice of generosity and so on, preceded by the taking of the vow.

original: dbye ba ni thun mong ste /
analyzed: dbye ba ni thun mong ste /
translated: The thought of vow is the thought of taking the vow.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa ste /

translated: The thought of entering is the practice of generosity and so on, preceded by the taking of the vow.🔽The thought of vow is the thought of taking the vow.🔽The thought of entering is the practice of generosity and so on, preceded by the taking of the vow.🔽The thought of vow is the thought of taking the vow.

analyzed: bla ma byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /

analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa mkhas pa nus pa dang ldan pa las blang ngo //
translated: The thought of entering is the practice of generosity and so on, preceded by the taking of the vow.

original: de med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams yid kyis dmigs la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams yid kyis dmigs la blang bar bya'o //
translated: If that is not available, one should take it from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, visualizing them in one's mind.

original: sems bskyed cing sdom ba nod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed cing sdom ba nod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ceremony for generating the Thought and taking the vow.

original: de nas bsrung bar bya ste srog gi phyir yang sdom pa nyams par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bsrung bar bya ste srog gi phyir yang sdom pa nyams par mi bya ste /
translated: Then one should keep the vow, not letting it deteriorate even for the sake of one's life.🔽It is better to die than to let the vow deteriorate.

original: bdag nyid shi ba ni bla'i tshe rabs thams cad du sha bsags na ni ri rab bas che la /
analyzed: bdag nyid shi ba ni bla'i tshe rabs thams cad du sha bsags na ni ri rab bas che la /
translated: In all one's lives, the accumulated flesh is greater than Mount Meru;

original: khrag bsags na ni rgya mtsho bas mang zhing /
analyzed: khrag bsags na ni rgya mtsho bas mang zhing /
translated: the accumulated blood is greater than the ocean;

original: rus bsags par gyur na ni rtsi shing bas mang zhing /
analyzed: rus bsags par gyur na ni rtsi shing bas mang zhing /
translated: and the accumulated bones are greater than the trees.

original: don med par 'khyams nas tshe 'di'i bar du mi gtsang ba'i phung po sna tshogs pa blangs shing /
analyzed: don med par 'khyams nas tshe 'di'i bar du mi gtsang ba'i phung po sna tshogs pa blangs shing /
translated: One has wandered aimlessly, and until this life has taken up various heaps of impurity.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chen po yang dang yang du nyams su myong par gyur pas //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chen po yang dang yang du nyams su myong par gyur pas //
translated: One has again and again experienced the great suffering of cyclic existence.

original: sdom pa ni nyams par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni nyams par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not let the vow deteriorate.

original: sdom pa yang ji ltar bla ma las blangs pa bzhin du bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang ji ltar bla ma las blangs pa bzhin du bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: And one should strive to keep the vow as it was taken from the guru.

original: de mi nyams par bsrung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de mi nyams par bsrung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual for protecting it from degeneration.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i snod du rung ba de theg pa chen po'i gdams ngag mnyan nas /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i snod du rung ba de theg pa chen po'i gdams ngag mnyan nas /
translated: Thus, having become a suitable vessel for the Mahayana, he should listen to the instructions of the Mahayana.

original: theg pa thun mong gi chos dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos kyi spang bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa thun mong gi chos dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos kyi spang bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes par bya ste /
translated: He should understand all the characteristics of the things to be eliminated, etc., of the Dharma of the common vehicle and the uncommon vehicle.

original: mtshan nyid ma shes par ni bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma shes par ni bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: Without understanding the characteristics, one cannot practice,

original: dmus long gis mar la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmus long gis mar la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as a blind man cannot use butter, etc.

original: de bas na thos pa'i shes rab @185b sngon du song bas mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa'i shes rab @185b sngon du song bas mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand the characteristics by means of the wisdom of hearing.

original: mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual for understanding the characteristics.

original: de ltar snong du rung zhing mtshan nyid shes par byas pa des sems sbyang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar snong du rung zhing mtshan nyid shes par byas pa des sems sbyang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having become a suitable vessel and having understood the characteristics, he should generate concentration in order to purify his mind.

original: thos ba tsam gyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos ba tsam gyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not be accomplished by mere hearing.

original: de bas na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sems sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sems sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should purify the mind by means of the wisdom of meditation.

original: de yang yan lag rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang yan lag rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: This has five parts:

original: rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis lam rgyud la bskyed pa dang / de yi yul dang / spang bar bya ba dang / spang ba'i thabs dang / spangs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis lam rgyud la bskyed pa dang / de yi yul dang / spang bar bya ba dang / spang ba'i thabs dang / spangs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the person who possesses the lineage and generates the path in the mindstream, the object of that, what is to be abandoned, the method of abandoning, and the result of abandoning.🔽Generating the path in the mindstream has three parts:

original: lam rgyud la bskyed pa la yang lam gyi grogs zhig nas dang // lhag mthong la bslab pa dang // de nas lam dngos te thabs dang shes rab la bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lam rgyud la bskyed pa la yang lam gyi grogs zhig nas dang // lhag mthong la bslab pa dang // de nas lam dngos te thabs dang shes rab la bslab pa'o //
translated: the path that is the friend of the path, training in vipaśyanā, and then the actual path, training in method and wisdom.

original: de la zhi gnas ni dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la nges par bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la nges par bya ste /
translated: Śamatha is ascertaining any suitable thing

original: sems kyi rgyun gyi skad cig ma de nyid du yang dang yang gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gyi skad cig ma de nyid du yang dang yang gtad par bya'o //
translated: and repeatedly focusing on that very instant of the mind stream.

original: gang gi yul de la sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi yul de la sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the mind rests on that object,

original: zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: know that śamatha has been perfected.

original: lhag mthong ni zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Vipaśyanā is the result of śamatha.

original: don de nyid la dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: don de nyid la dpyod pa'o //
translated: It is the analysis of that very object.

original: lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ni zung du 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ni zung du 'brel ba ste /
translated: The result of vipaśyanā is the unification of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: yul gang la yang mi gnas pas yul de nyid bye brag tu mthong la /
analyzed: yul gang la yang mi gnas pas yul de nyid bye brag tu mthong la /
translated: Since it does not dwell on any object, it sees that very object as distinct.

original: de nyid kyi tshe sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dmigs pa du ma la rgyug pa rab tu zhi bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dmigs pa du ma la rgyug pa rab tu zhi bar gnas pa'o //
translated: At that time, since the mind becomes one-pointed, the running to many objects of meditation is pacified.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pa de 'dod chags la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar gyur na 'dod chags kyi gnyen por ni mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pa de 'dod chags la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar gyur na 'dod chags kyi gnyen por ni mi sdug pa ste /
translated: If that yogin's mind becomes distracted by desire and so on, the antidote to desire is the meditation on foulness,

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa sgom pa'o //
translated: such as the impurities and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang gi gnyen por ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang gi gnyen por ni byams pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the antidote to anger is love.

original: gti mug gi gnyen por ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi gnyen por ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The antidote to delusion is dependent origination.

original: nga rgyal gyi gnyen por ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'o /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi gnyen por ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'o /
translated: The antidote to pride is the classification of the elements.

original: khying ba'i gnyen por snang ba'i 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: khying ba'i gnyen por snang ba'i 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to jealousy is the perception of light and bringing to mind the good qualities of the Buddha and so on.

original: rgod pa'i gnyen por ni mi rtag pa yid la byed pas sngon dgod pa dang rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran ba de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen por ni mi rtag pa yid la byed pas sngon dgod pa dang rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran ba de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: The antidote to agitation is to recollect previous laughter, play, and joy, and to think about impermanence.

original: sems der mi dga' bar gyur pa'i tshe ni mi dga' ba'i skyon bsam zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsams pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems der mi dga' bar gyur pa'i tshe ni mi dga' ba'i skyon bsam zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsams pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When the mind is not pleased with samādhi, one should think about the faults of not being pleased and the good qualities of samādhi.

original: bying rgod la sogs pa dang bral nas sems cha mnyam par 'jug cing gnas par gyur pa'i tshe //
analyzed: bying rgod la sogs pa dang bral nas sems cha mnyam par 'jug cing gnas par gyur pa'i tshe //
translated: When the mind is free from agitation and so forth, and is evenly engaged and settled,

original: bsgrims pa glod la @186a * //
analyzed: bsgrims pa glod la @186a * //
translated: one should relax one’s effort.

original: btang snyoms su bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms su bya ste /
translated: One should be equanimous.

original: sems mnyam par 'jug pa la bsgrims par byas na g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jug pa la bsgrims par byas na g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is too tight, the mind will be distracted.

original: de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la slob pa'i gang zag des gong nas gong du gyur pa'i las ni mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab las mtshan ma med pa'i lhag mthong rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la slob pa'i gang zag des gong nas gong du gyur pa'i las ni mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab las mtshan ma med pa'i lhag mthong rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro
translated: The person who is training in serenity and insight in this way, by means of the higher stages, will generate nonconceptual wisdom, which is insight free of signs, from the wisdom that discerns signs in the serenity free of signs.

original: // de yang lam dngos te thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: // de yang lam dngos te thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas so //
translated: This is the actual path, because it is the cultivation of method and wisdom.

original: bsgom pa yang rnam par dbye bas lnga ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa yang rnam par dbye bas lnga ste /
translated: Cultivation is fivefold,

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / sgom pa'i lam sa gnyis pa nas bdun pa dang / brgyad pa nas bcu pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / sgom pa'i lam sa gnyis pa nas bdun pa dang / brgyad pa nas bcu pa ste /
translated: because it is the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the path beyond training.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa gsum mo //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa gsum mo //
translated: The path of meditation is the three levels of engagement through belief.

original: 'dir mos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: 'dir mos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The term “belief” here

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang / brtson pa che thang du byed pas mos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang / brtson pa che thang du byed pas mos pa ste /
translated: means belief in one’s own and others’ aims and the great enthusiasm that results from that belief.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni ma yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni ma yin par dgongs so //
translated: The path of preparation is not intended here.

original: khyad par gyi lam ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ste /
translated: The path of meditation is the path of distinctive features.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te //
translated: and the vajra-like samadhi.

original: de la thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad do //
translated: Here, the means are the other perfections such as generosity, the immeasurables, and all virtuous dharmas.

original: shes rab ni thabs de phyin ci ma log par byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs de phyin ci ma log par byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is what makes those means unmistaken.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that all dharmas are the nature of emptiness, unborn.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i skabs su /
translated: On the path of accumulation, in the context of the factors conducive to liberation,

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / sems dang chos dran pa nye par gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / sems dang chos dran pa nye par gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
translated: one cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness: the establishment of mindfulness of the body, and likewise, of feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad skyes pa med par byas pa dang / ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad skyes pa med par byas pa dang / ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ste /
translated: Having made all unvirtuous dharmas that have arisen cease, one prevents those that have not arisen from arising, and one causes all virtuous dharmas that have not arisen to arise and those that have arisen to increase.

original: yang dag par spongs ba bzhi dang / 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spongs ba bzhi dang / 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the four right efforts, the four legs of manifestation, which are the legs of manifestation endowed with the meditative concentration of will and the applications of abandoning, and similarly, the legs of manifestation endowed with the meditative concentration of perseverance, of mind, and of investigation and the applications of abandoning.

original: de nas sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i skabs su dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga ste /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i skabs su dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga ste /
translated: Then, on the path of preparation, in the context of the factors conducive to penetrative insight, one should cultivate the five faculties and the five powers.

original: de yang drod dang rtse mo'i dus su dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab @186b kyi dbang po ste lnga'o //
analyzed: de yang drod dang rtse mo'i dus su dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab @186b kyi dbang po ste lnga'o //
translated: At the times of heat and peak, they are the five faculties: faith, perseverance, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog gi dus su dad pa la sogs pa de nyid stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba la stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog gi dus su dad pa la sogs pa de nyid stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba la stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: At the times of acceptance and the highest worldly realization, those same faculties of faith and so on become powerful and are called the five powers.

original: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the power of faith and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Then the path of insight.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gis phye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gis phye ba'o //
translated: It is divided into the members of enlightenment.

original: de yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / de bzhin du chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / de bzhin du chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: They are the member of enlightenment that is right mindfulness, and similarly, the investigation of the teaching, energy, joy, serenity, concentration, and equanimity.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang ; 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang ; 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: Therein, the four noble truths are the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: bden pa rnam pa bzhi chos bcu drug tu dmigs pa med par bsgoms pas shes bzod bcu drug tu rtogs nas mtheng ba'i lam thob ba'o //🔽de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bzhi chos bcu drug tu dmigs pa med par bsgoms pas shes bzod bcu drug tu rtogs nas mtheng ba'i lam thob ba'o // de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: By cultivating the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths without objectifying them, one realizes the sixteen aspects of knowledge and patience and attains the path of insight.🔽Then the path of cultivation.

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: It is divided into the members of the path.

original: de yang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / de bzhin du yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang rtsol ba dang dran pa dang yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /

analyzed: de ltar snod du rung ba dang / bla ma dam pa las sngags kyi mtshan nyid shes @190a * //
